heading: Technical Skills
sub-heading: Knowledge of research methods, techniques & application of these in small scale research projects
content: Knowledge of research and analytical methodologies and ability to demonstrate practical application of both qualitative and quantitative approaches through project based work; for example, a suitable level of experience would be that obtained from obtaining a 1st or 2:1 degree or a postgraduate qualification in a social science discipline, that includes a substantial element of social research methods and training

heading: Technical Skills
sub-heading: Knowledge of research methods, techniques & application of these in small scale research projects
content: Working knowledge of a range of research methods and an awareness of new innovative methods, including within the data science field.

heading: Technical Skills
sub-heading: Knowledge of research methods, techniques & application of these in small scale research projects
content: Broad awareness of the role of quantitative and qualitative social research methods and their application, i.e., knowing when their application is appropriate and when it is not

heading: Technical Skills
sub-heading: Knowledge of research methods, techniques & application of these in small scale research projects
content: Uses both qualitative and quantitative approaches to undertake small in-house pieces of work while under supervision

heading: Technical Skills
sub-heading: Knowledge of research methods, techniques & application of these in small scale research projects
content: Carries out analytical tasks under directions

heading: Technical Skills
sub-heading: Knowledge of research methods, techniques & application of these in small scale research projects
content: Prepares accurate statistics

heading: Technical Skills
sub-heading: Identifying research needs, designing & specifying research
content: Designs small scale and less complex research projects for either in-house or commissioned projects; understands how to get things done in the Civil Service

heading: Technical Skills
sub-heading: Identifying research needs, designing & specifying research
content: Helps line manager identify areas for new research

heading: Technical Skills
sub-heading: Identifying research needs, designing & specifying research
content: Writes and designs draft research specifications for less complex projects

heading: Technical Skills
sub-heading: Identifying research needs, designing & specifying research
content: Defines research questions, and re-defines where necessary

heading: Technical Skills
content: Makes use of different sources of information and carries out basic analysis of key data sets by producing frequencies and cross tabulations; interprets the key findings from this

heading: Technical Skills
content: Uses computer software in the analysis and presentation of information

heading: Technical Skills
content: Working knowledge of relevant data analysis packages, particularly SPSS and Excel, and qualitative packages. Packages to be determined by the particular role and job content

heading: Technical Skills
content: Introductory level knowledge of data science techniques

heading: Technical Skills
content: Accurately interprets data (verbal & numerical) and research papers, for example, makes an accurate interpretation of the key findings from a literature search

heading: Technical Skills
content: Summarises verbally and numerically expressed research information accurately

heading: Technical Skills
content: Aware of key departmental procurement procedures

heading: Technical Skills
content: Judges accurately the merits of less complex research tenders

heading: Technical Skills
content: Supports team members in managing more complex external research projects

heading: Technical Skills
content: Working knowledge of ethical issues in research; knowledge of GSR principles on research ethics and SRA's guidance; with support, is able to apply these when developing appropriate solutions/ proposals

heading: Technical Skills
content: Working knowledge of legal requirements surrounding research, particularly data protection and the Freedom of Information Act; knows when to seek further support

heading: Technical Skills
content: Sensitive to legal requirements that may surround particular departmental research agenda; knows when to seek further support

heading: Technical Skills
content: Demonstrates attention to detail in checking information/evidence for accuracy and validity, for example, checking an interim research report from a contractor

heading: Technical Skills
content: Critically assesses research findings against an established standard or specification

heading: Technical Skills
content: Uses logic to evaluate new ideas and alternatives, for example, critically assesses new hypotheses or new methodologies

heading: Technical Skills
content: Has knowledge of quality assurance methodologies required for analytical work and understands the context and relevance of quality assurance products, such as the Aqua Book

heading: Technical Skills
content: Has good knowledge of research methodology, methods, and the latest techniques (i.e. demonstrated through qualifications and/or experience) and ability to apply these in small scale research projects

heading: Technical Skills
content: Able to design small scale and less complex research projects, defining research questions and writing draft specifications

heading: Technical Skills
content: Able to summarise and interpret information accurately, making use of different sources and to conduct basic analyses of key data sets utilising a working knowledge of relevant data analysis packages

heading: Technical Skills
content: Has good working knowledge of departmental procurement procedures, quality assurance processes, legal and ethical issues and principles relating to social research. Uses ability to critically assess and evaluate information and evidence, to support team members in managing more complex external research projects (judging merits of research tenders, assessing research findings, evaluating new ideas or methodologies)

content: Works with other social researchers and/or analysts

content: Delivers appropriate and timely analysis to support policy making and policy implementation, seeking support from senior colleagues where appropriate

content: Clear knowledge of the format and style required to report research results; able to report research information clearly in writing

sub-heading: Leading, communicating and championing social research
content: Persuades others to support the research process, for example, industry bodies to release necessary information or policy customers of the value of social research

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Knows when to consult with others, for example, with GSR colleagues, other analytical professions or policy colleagues

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Uses the GSR network to increase awareness of cross cutting research possibilities

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Understands the role and social research needs of policy divisions and can link that to own output

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Tailors approach and frames research output in a way that is directly relevant to the customer's needs

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Understands the policy context of own work

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Identify opportunities to expand knowledge and breadth of skills

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Commit time to learning and sharing knowledge with others around approaches to research

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Persuades others to support the research process and works to increase awareness of cross cutting research possibilities

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Uses understanding of policy context to deliver appropriate and timely analysis and clear reporting of research results, tailored to customer needs

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Actively supports and contributes to wider GSR community

heading: Technical Skills
sub-heading: Knowledge of research methods, techniques & application of these in more complex projects
content: As Research Officer plus around two years successful applied experience of working in applied social research in which strong analytical skills have been clearly demonstrated. This can include work towards successful completion of a post graduate qualification with a strong research/research methods component

heading: Technical Skills
sub-heading: Knowledge of research methods, techniques & application of these in more complex projects
content: Thorough and detailed knowledge of the main quantitative, qualitative and evaluation research methods and experience of their use in more complex projects

heading: Technical Skills
sub-heading: Knowledge of research methods, techniques & application of these in more complex projects
content: Understands the pros and cons of different research methods so can advise, critique and make independent direct use of same

heading: Technical Skills
sub-heading: Knowledge of research methods, techniques & application of these in more complex projects
content: Uses a range of analytical techniques to carry out in-house analysis & briefing work

heading: Technical Skills
sub-heading: Knowledge of research methods, techniques & application of these in more complex projects
content: Up-to-date knowledge of methodological developments including the role of innovative methodologies; applies these methods when and where appropriate; makes use of appropriate new developments from other analytical professions and outside the Civil Service where relevant

heading: Technical Skills
sub-heading: Knowledge of research methods, techniques & application of these in more complex projects
content: Incorporates the latest techniques into their work where appropriate, and champions innovation and embraces new ways of working.

heading: Technical Skills
sub-heading: Knowledge of research methods, techniques & application of these in more complex projects
content: Good knowledge & application of analytical techniques to address key questions

heading: Technical Skills
sub-heading: Knowledge of research methods, techniques & application of these in more complex projects
content: Assesses the suitability for purpose of alternative research methods

heading: Technical Skills

content: Brings a fresh approach to devising research methods, for example, designing questionnaires, modifying a methodology

heading: Technical Skills
sub-heading: Knowledge of research methods, techniques & application of these in more complex projects
content: Generates imaginative and useful hypotheses which can be tested

heading: Technical Skills
sub-heading: Identifying research needs, designing & specifying research
content: Draws upon a track record of designing medium sized or more complex projects to translate a policy question into a viable research specification or in-house project

heading: Technical Skills
sub-heading: Identifying research needs, designing & specifying research
content: Meets the social research needs of several divisions and areas, for example, through consulting with other stakeholders and analysts at an early stage, clarifying objectives and setting deliverable goals

heading: Technical Skills
sub-heading: Identifying research needs, designing & specifying research
content: Clarifies and agrees research objectives and outputs

heading: Technical Skills
sub-heading: Identifying research needs, designing & specifying research
content: Translates broad projects aims into researchable questions, for example, turns policy requirements into well designed research specifications

heading: Technical Skills
sub-heading: Identifying research needs, designing & specifying research
content: Accurately identifies where there are gaps in the evidence base and makes sound recommendations for how this can be managed

heading: Technical Skills
sub-heading: Identifying research needs, designing & specifying research
content: Reframes a vague or unhelpful research question to one that can provide outputs that meets the customer’s needs

heading: Technical Skills
sub-heading: Identifying research needs, designing & specifying research
content: Incorporates best practice guidance into research specification and management

heading: Technical Skills
content: Weighs up competing sources of data and identifies a clear line to take

heading: Technical Skills
content: Assesses relevance of research information to the task in hand

heading: Technical Skills
content: Identifies salient points and trends from research or other information and draws out sound, logical inferences, for example, picks out key messages from dense data sets

heading: Technical Skills
content: Experience also of having had direct responsibility for management of commissioned research or for undertaking social or other relevant research projects of a significant scale. The above also needs to include some experience of having worked with other analysts, for example, economists, statisticians

heading: Technical Skills
content: Specifies, commissions and manages research projects; works within agreed budgets

heading: Technical Skills
content: Understands the basics of research planning, including bidding timetables, thinking ahead and liaising with policy divisions

heading: Technical Skills
content: Assesses whether a contractor’s report is based on a sound approach and robust analysis

heading: Technical Skills
content: As RO but for more complex projects. Overall an ability to manage independently the entire procurement process for all but the most complex projects, including budgetary requirements

heading: Technical Skills
content: Takes responsibility and action to ensure that the legal and ethical compliance needs of research projects are met; Knows when to seek further support on legal or ethical issues

heading: Technical Skills
content: Liaises successfully with ethics committees, and other monitoring/ compliance committees, for particular projects

heading: Technical Skills
content: Applies GDPR principles where appropriate to particular projects

heading: Technical Skills
content: Manages research processes and contractors so ensuring quality of results and methodological rigour

heading: Technical Skills
content: Has knowledge of, and incorporates quality assurance processes within all analytical work, making use of relevant quality assurance products, such as the Aqua Book

heading: Technical Skills
content: Monitors and reviews performance and progress of research contractors and anticipates necessary action

heading: Technical Skills
content: Demonstrates a thorough knowledge of research methodology, method, and the latest techniques, including main quantitative, qualitative and evaluation methods (at e.g. post graduate level) with around two years applied experience. Is up to date with methodological developments.

heading: Technical Skills
content: Holds a track record of designing medium scale or more complex projects, applying best practice guidance, identifying new areas for work, translating policy requirements into robust specifications that will meet customer needs

heading: Technical Skills
content: Able to accurately evaluate competing data sources and identify salient points and trends to draw sound, logical inferences

heading: Technical Skills
content: Has experience of managing research projects of significant scale, working with other analysts and ensuring relevant legal, ethical, procurement, and quality assurance practice followed, ensuring quality of results and methodological rigour

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Looks beneath the surface of a request for advice or a piece of research, thinks laterally and explores different angles critically and analytically

content: Conducts a risk analysis of an evidence base to ensure advice is sound, for example, understands the trade-offs in balancing quality and timing of - project delivery

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research

content: Understands policy context and timescales, explaining different angles critically and analytically, works with other analysts to best meet customer needs

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Provides expertise and shapes expectations and needs through educating others on social research

content: Evaluates and integrates research information from a variety of sources to come to logical conclusions

content: Understands and can work within the budgetary requirements at the research project level

content: Manages quality and product assurance issues on projects, developing quality and product assurance requirements with customers and analysts prior to projects commencing.

content: Holds an established track record (around three/three plus years) in designing, carrying out and managing social research, and providing research based advice and briefings

heading: Technical Skills
content: Applies understanding of customer needs and ability to see bigger picture to identify research needs and evidence gaps and to deliver effective research designs to meet these needs

content: Evaluates and integrates research information from a variety of sources, coming to logical conclusions and communicating this effectively to senior non-specialists, assisting them to take on key findings and implications

content: Has strong research commissioning and management experience and ability to develop research coordination strategy, understanding contribution of other analytical professions Principal Research Officer: Using & Promoting Social Research

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research

content: Communicates accurately and in an engaging manner complex research findings to senior people and influential audiences in a variety of situations often with very little notice, for example, briefing a media audience with a short attention span; understands the impression that one creates in others and adjusts own style and content accordingly whilst being true to the research

content: Integrates information from a range of sources and analytical disciplines to give balanced politically aware advice that proactively informs policy and practice

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
sub-heading: Leading, communicating and championing social research
content: Educates customers, shapes their expectations and influences the research requests they make; creates an ‘intelligent customer’; identifies and meets the strategic information needs of customers and partners, for example links the customer’s political and delivery priorities with social research findings; implements a strategy for building the customer base further

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
sub-heading: Leading, communicating and championing social research
content: Is an authoritative voice on social research matters in both the civil service and outside institutions; is instrumental in raising the profile of social research within the department; pro-actively develops the ‘public role’ of government social research (e.g. serves on steering committees, furthers relationships with research councils; publishes in journals; encourages junior staff to do likewise)

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
sub-heading: Leading, communicating and championing social research
content: Builds and maintains influential relationships with the ‘top of the office’, i.e., ministers, special advisers, senior members of own department; promotes and sells the value and unique contribution of social research to a diverse audience

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
sub-heading: Leading, communicating and championing social research
content: Presents a compelling case for the value of social research to a wider audience; aligns policy and delivery with clear communications objectives and measurement criteria

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
sub-heading: Leading, communicating and championing social research
content: Sets out vision/ future direction and sells unit's role and work to key stakeholders in the external analytical community

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
sub-heading: Leading, communicating and championing social research
content: Promotes the value of social research to the department, the wider Civil Service and the outside world, e.g. ensuring a presence at conferences and in journals

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
sub-heading: Leading, communicating and championing social research
content: Persuades customers and stakeholders to use social research in their key policy areas; ensures that the implications of important research becomes customer knowledge

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
sub-heading: Leading, communicating and championing social research
content: Works with partners to identify customers and actively broaden the customer base; encourages other social researchers and analysts to do the same

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
sub-heading: Leading, communicating and championing social research
content: Negotiates in pressured situations, for example, challenges the budgetary constraints of social research at the departmental level

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Makes use of different analytical disciplines and diverse talents to deliver results

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Facilitates and links the ideas and contributions from a range of analytical disciplines to generate robust solutions

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Collaborates with other senior analysts and policy colleagues to develop a coherent and integrated research vision that reflects the contribution of each discipline, creates synergy and demonstrates excellent cross functional awareness

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Understands the implications of the latest research evidence for own policy areas; shares this information with key stakeholders and customers

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Anticipates customers' priorities; systematically ensures the unit's research capability and evidence base is relevant to the short term and strategic priorities of key customers

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Influences the customer's research priorities; internal dialogue and research agenda through asking them the right questions

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Acutely aware of the potential political implications for customers of the research and develops contingency plans on how to manage this

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Works in partnership with customers to develop policy/delivery action plans in light of research findings

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Keeps abreast of key developments within the department as well as in the wider internal and external research community

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Proposes and defends a position taking into account political and organisational sensitivities even in challenging situations, for example, stands up to ministers on matters of research publication

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Sets out the policy and political consequences of research results so these wider implications are readily understood

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Quality assures the social research output conducted by the unit; proactively links output to the strategic needs of the department

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Motivates staff by instilling professional integrity and high professional standards; encourages breadth and depth of research skills and knowledge and their application to effective delivery of policy

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Actively promotes a work culture that encourages the use of innovative research methods and analytical techniques; challenges staff to consider new methods in social research and evaluation and how they can be applied to the policy delivery context

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Sets and promotes a learning and improving culture in the unit for all staff; ensures access and opportunities are equal across the unit, for example, considers training across analytical disciplines

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Exposes staff to the wider professional community of social researchers and other analytical disciplines to facilitate learning

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Mediates effectively when there is a professional dispute, for example, on issues of methodology, or the use of social research evidence in a particular context; able to judge whether disputes are of critical importance and knows when to step in and when not to

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Engagingly and accurately communicates relevant findings from complex research programmes to senior people and influential audiences, to give politically aware advice that informs policy and practice

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Sets a learning culture for all staff, instilling professional integrity and high professional standards in line with the GSR code, encouraging breadth and depth in research skills including innovative methodologies and techniques and good understanding of other analytical disciplines

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Demonstrates excellent cross functional awareness, making use of different analytical disciplines to deliver robust solutions, collaborating with senior analysts and policy colleagues to develop a coherent and integrated research vision that reflects the contribution of each analytical discipline and meets customer needs

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Champions excellence in social research practices and application, creates intelligent customers and builds customer base, builds and maintains influential relationships with the ‘top of the office’ and key stakeholders outside government, presenting a compelling case for the value of social research.

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Uses understanding of evidence base, policy area and customers priorities to influence research priorities. Ensures policy and political implications of research are understood and managed, develops policy / delivery action plans in partnership with customers and ensures research capability and evidence base is relevant to short term and strategic priorities of key customers

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Provides strategic leadership to further develop the social research profession and its role in the broader analytical community
